meanings.definition: The act of realizing or making real
meanings.sent1: Her realisation of her dream to become a doctor filled her with joy.
meanings.sent2: The realisation of the importance of education is crucial for a better future.
meanings.sent3: His realisation of forgetting his keys at home led to a funny situation.
meanings.sent4: The realisation of how small we are in the universe can be humbling.
meanings.sent5: The sudden realisation of the storm approaching made everyone rush indoors.

meanings.definition: The state of being realized or made real
meanings.sent1: The realisation of her efforts finally paid off with a promotion.
meanings.sent2: In the realisation of his dream, he felt a sense of accomplishment.
meanings.sent3: The realisation of being the only one left in the room was eerie.
meanings.sent4: The realisation of love can bring warmth to even the coldest heart.
meanings.sent5: The realisation of the sun setting painted the sky in beautiful colors.

meanings.definition: The result of realizing or making real
meanings.sent1: The realisation of their hard work was a successful product launch.
meanings.sent2: His realisation of the truth brought closure to the long-standing mystery.
meanings.sent3: The realisation of the cake being gone left everyone disappointed.
meanings.sent4: The realisation of time slipping away urged him to make the most of each moment.
meanings.sent5: The realisation of the mountain peak in the distance motivated them to keep climbing.
